itemListElement.name: Vegan Lentil Quinoa Loaf, Vegan Cornbread Stuffing, Spicy Cranberry Sauce, Pumpkin Pie

@graph.name: Vegan Cornbread Stuffing
@graph.description: Freshly baked Pumpkin cornbread, stuffing veggies baked into a flavorful cornbread stuffing. Vegan, can be made gluten-free. Serves 4
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup pumpkin puree or sweet potato puree
1/2 cup almond milk  (or other non dairy milk to make nut-free)
1 Tbsp olive oil or melted vegan butter

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, add cornmeal, flour, salt, baking powder. Whisk well. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, add cornmeal, flour, salt, baking powder. Whisk well. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour batter in a greased 8 inch or smaller cake pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour batter in a greased 8 inch or smaller cake pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at pre-heated 375 degrees F / 190ºc for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before slicing or crumbling to use in the stuffing.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at pre-heated 375 degrees F / 190ºc for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before slicing or crumbling to use in the stuffing.

recipeInstructions.text: Make it gluten-free: Use any gf flour blend or oat flour instead of while flour. the bread will be crumbly. Crumble it into the stuffing.
recipeInstructions.name: Make it gluten-free: Use any gf flour blend or oat flour instead of while flour. the bread will be crumbly. Crumble it into the stuffing.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions and garlic and cook for 5 minutes. or until translucent
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions and garlic and cook for 5 minutes. or until translucent

recipeInstructions.text: Add celery, carrots, sage, thyme, oregano, salt and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until the veggies are tender. Add in the raisins, corn, greens and mix . Cook for 2 minutes or until the greens are lightly wilted. Take off heat. Mix in half of the cilantro and scallions . Taste and adjust salt and flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Add celery, carrots, sage, thyme, oregano, salt and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until the veggies are tender. Add in the raisins, corn, greens and mix . Cook for 2 minutes or until the greens are lightly wilted. Take off heat. Mix in half of the cilantro and scallions . Taste and adjust salt and flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the almond milk with maple and olive oil. Add to the skillet. Add crumbled cornbread and toss well.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the almond milk with maple and olive oil. Add to the skillet. Add crumbled cornbread and toss well.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the mixture to greased baking pan. 9 by 7 inch or larger
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the mixture to greased baking pan. 9 by 7 inch or larger

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 350 degrees f / 180ºc for 15 minutes. Broil for a minute to crisp up the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 350 degrees f / 180ºc for 15 minutes. Broil for a minute to crisp up the top.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the remaining cilantro and scallions and black pepper. and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle the remaining cilantro and scallions and black pepper. and serve.
